title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

entries.title: Amanda Knox convicted in slander retrial in Italy over 2007 killing of her roommate
entries.description: Amanda Knox, an American previously convicted and later exonerated of the 2007 murder of her housemate while studying in Italy, faced another legal setback on Wednesday. An Italian court found Knox guilty of slander related to the same case. Knox...

entries.title: Lift-off finally: Boeing launches its1st crewed space flight on third try
entries.description: Boeing's new Starliner astronaut capsule was launched from Florida on Wednesday in a long-awaited test flight carrying a crew. This marks a significant milestone for the aerospace giant as it aims to compete with Elon Musk's SpaceX. The CST-100...

entries.title: Ukraine has used US weapons to hit inside Russia: Western official
entries.description: Ukraine has recently used US-supplied weapons to carry out strikes inside Russia, according to a well-informed Western official. These actions were carried out under new guidance approved by President Joe Biden. This guidance permits the use of...

entries.title: Israel ‘targets’ US lawmakers with covert influence drive
entries.description: srael organized and funded an influence campaign last year aimed at US lawmakers and the American public. The goal was to promote pro-Israel messaging and garner support for its actions in the Gaza Strip conflict. The covert initiative was overseen...

entries.title: Western arms deliveries to Ukraine are 'very dangerous step': Putin
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday cautioned that supplying arms to Ukraine by Western nations is 'a very dangerous step.' He emphasized the risk of heightened tensions if donor countries are 'controlling' the use of these weapons....

A Russian cosmonaut becomes the first person to spend 1,000 days in space
entries.description: 59-year-old Russian cosmonaut Oleg Kononenko becomes the first person to spend 1,000 days in space, alongside NASA astronaut Loral O'Hara and compatriot Nikolai Chub.

entries.title: After crackdown on Hong Kong, overseas communities carry the torch to keep Tiananmen memories alive
entries.description: Prominent scholar Rowena He flies between the US, Britain, and Canada to speak out for those unable to commemorate the Tiananmen Square crackdown, a taboo subject in mainland China. Hong Kong's clampdown on dissidents has erased the annual vigil...

entries.title: Biden: ‘Every reason’ to believe Bibi prolonging war for political survival
entries.description: US President Joe Biden addressed concerns about whether Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu might be extending the conflict in Gaza to remain in power. Biden remarked, "there is every reason for people to draw that conclusion," echoing...

entries.title: Russia bots target Paris Olympics with deepfake Tom Cruise video
entries.description: Russia, facing a ban on its athletes competing under the national flag at the Summer Olympics, has directed its anger towards the Games and the host city, Paris. According to a Sunday report by Microsoft, Russian propagandists have produced an...

entries.title: Aus military to recruit non-citizens in a bid to boost troop numbers
entries.description: The Australian military is set to start recruiting certain non-citizens to increase its troop numbers, the government announced on Tuesday. This initiative will be open only to individuals from other Five Eyes intelligence-sharing countries who...

entries.title: Sunak & Starmer set for first debate face-off as disruptor Farage roils UK election waters
entries.description: The two main contenders for Britain's next prime minister, Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer, faced off in a televised debate. Nigel Farage's announcement to run for parliament with Reform UK dealt a blow to Sunak's election hopes.

entries.description: President Joe Biden is looking past resistance from key Israeli officials as he presses Israel and Hamas to agree to a three-phase agreement that could immediately bring home dozens of Israeli hostages, free Palestinian prisoners and perhaps even...

entries.title: In another blow to PM, Brexit champion to stand in UK polls
entries.description: Nigel Farage, a key figure in advocating for Britain's exit from the EU, announced on Monday his intention to run in next month's election. Farage, 60, will lead the rightwing Reform Party, marking a significant development for Prime Minister Rishi...

entries.title: MI6 turned two China govt staff to spies: Beijing
entries.description: China has accused the British Secret Intelligence Service MI6 of recruiting two employees from undisclosed Chinese central state organs to work as spies for the British government. The announcement came through a statement by China's state security...
